Replies.Reply: Jesus, where's the cable guy already?
I don't want to talk about it.
Yeah.
Robin and I have been having a difficult time. I moved out, but I really think it's only temporary.
Sorry to disturb you.
You've got to be kidding? Please tell me she's a friend of yours. You're just playing with my mind again, right?
Okay.
This is all a mistake. I didn't accept any stolen goods.
Ring?
Hello.
Horrible. The cable guy is missing in action. Apparently he's going to be here sometime between eight AM and my death.
No, I'm giving her space.
I can't believe she's doing this.
All she had to do was say no. She didn't have to kick me out. I feel like Felix Unger.
It's my first night here. Don't do this to me.
Fine, fine.
I couldn't. I'm not good at that stuff.
Where the hell is he?
Forget it. Idiots.
Oh great.
Don't leave! I'm here! I'm here!
Hey, wait!
You were supposed to be here four hours ago.
Yes. I had to go to the Bed 'n Bath place, but now it's closed.
What happened?
These go to your boss?
What?
I really don't want to talk about it with you. Could you please just install my cable? I'm going to get dressed.
Okay, whatever.
How's it going?
What happened?
IÂ guess so.
So after this I'll only need one remote for everything?
One thing.
IÂ uhÂ I have this friend and he said he gave his cable guy fifty bucks and he got free movie channels. Have you ever heard of anything like that?
UhÂ yes.
Forget it.
Oh, great. How much?
That is so nice.
Thanks. Really.
Sure. We should do that one day.
Tomorrow? Tomorrow's not good.
No.
You didn't cross the line.

ÂThere are twenty-four classrooms; each can be converted into a 1400 square foot home. The facility has two tennis courts, an Olympic size pool and full gym, with a stage if the residents decide they want to perform "Oklahoma."

The kitsch appeal of living in an old schoolhouse should be very attractive to young, upwardly mobile home buyers. And most important, the structure is available in foreclosure. If we put down a cash bid, we're going to steal this thing.
Absolutely. Now I've got more time than ever. It's a good thing.
I know I can pull this thing off.
Then what are you doing talking to me?
Thank you. I will.
I'll be right back.
Hello.
I was just in the area. Thought I'd pop by. How's work? How'd the big teen crush article come out?
I know, it's just Daniels accepted my proposal to renovate the old schoolhouse.
I know I'm breaking the rules, but come have dinner with me tonight to celebrate.
Come on, this is the biggest day of my career.
What position? I want to share this with you.
Thanks.
What the hell.
How's it going?
Where exactly are we goin?
That's pretty impressive.
I've watched a lot of TV in my life. I guess I've always taken it for granted.
I know what you mean. My dad was there, but he might as well have been gone. My mom is a stewardess. She was always out of town.
You know my brother's a speech therapist.
Never mind.
I miss her. I asked her to marry me, and she asked me to move out.
She said she felt pressured. Can you believe that?
You're right. That is remarkably insightful.
Robin loves that movie.
Maybe I will.
Thanks a lot. I'm embarrassed to say this, but I don't know your name. What is it?
I'll see ya' Chip.
UhÂ good-bye.

I don't listen to you. I pretend to understand but I'm really just saying what I think you want to hear. So from now on I'm going to try my best to listen more because I do love you and am interested in learning about every detail about the complicated splendor that is you.
I want us to get back together, but I can see why taking this time might be good for us. So, I'm not mad.
You're right. Well, that's what I came here to say. Look, I've got to get back to the office.
I'm just going to cook myself dinner and watch a movie. "Sleepless in Seattle" is on cable.
If you're around you should drop by and check out the new apartment.
Here, here, here.
Not your fault. I'm in the zone. There is no stopping me today.
This isÂ Chip DouglasÂ my cable guy.
Are you any good?
What are you doing?
Yeah. I'm fine.
What are you doing?
You ruined the game.
What are you talking about? I don't even know you!
No, I'm going home.
Yeah, have a good one.
Hey, good to see you.
Come on in. What do you think of the place?
That's actually where the movers put the furniture. I'm gonna change it, very soon.
Work's good.
Don't get me started. That guy has no vision. It's like working for Mr. MaGoo.
I know. Now if only someone at corporate smartened up enough to dump Hal, then I could really get some stuff done.
Well, it's nice just to see you.
Hey, it should be starting.
Damn cable is out. Son of a bitch.
No, no. We really should see it now.
Wait, wait. I know what to do.
The Cable Guy's a friend of mine. I'll just page him. We'll have this fixed in no time.
That wasÂ fast.
YeahÂ my cable went out.
I've been really busy. You've got to get my cable going, Robin is here. This is really important.
I'm sorry. Please, you've got to help me.
Fine, whatever you want.
So what's with the cut cord?
Nobody.
Pretty well. We'll see. Look, about the other night. I didn't appreciate you --
I really don't need to be surprised.
Medieval Times?
Funny. I never thought I would ever come here.
Please don't.
Good to know.
Thanks for the help.
Really? What does she look like?
Are you serious?
I've got to look.
You got me.
Could I get a knife and fork?
There were no utensils, but there was Pepsi?
Way to go Red Knight. Good job of killing. Good work.
How do I put this? I've really enjoyed hanging out with you, but...
Oh lord.
I want you to know --
What's going on?
Is this a normal part of the show?
Is this safe?
What are we supposed to do? We've got to be careful we don't hurt each other.
Just take it easy.
What are you doing?!
Hey, watch it!
Chip, this isn't funny! Will you stop it!
Jesus.
Don't do this!
Oh my god.
Are you okay?
I've got to admit there's a real feeling of power holding that jousting stick.
We should go again next week.
What is this?
You went in my house when I wasn't home?
How much did this cost?
Look, I can't accept this. I wouldn't feel right.
And you've given me friendship, so we're even.
Really, don't take it personally, but you've got to take it back.
Sure, no problem. And don't get me wrong. I really appreciate the gesture.
Oh, right.
Robin, it's Steven again. I'm still trying to reach you. Okay, I'm at work.
Good.
Good good?
Great.
Hey, I had the best time the other night.
Chip?
What do you mean?
Hey Robin. What's up? Did you get my message?
Sorry. I've been trying to reach you 'cause I'm having a party.
Dinner? What, like a date?
You've got a date?! I thought things were going well between us.
So why are you going out on a date?
I'm not freaking out.
I'm not. I just can't believe you would do this.
Fine, enjoy yourself. Have fun.
Fine. Bye.
You're probably right.
Oh, I got you a little something.
So shoot me.
My brother said it might help with your lisp.
It's no big deal.
You've got plenty of friends.
You're playing with me again.
Shut up.
Who'd she come with?
Hey. I'm Steven.
Can I get you something to drink?
Coming right up.
Why? This is a great party. This girl is really into me.
You don't even know him. You're just mad 'cause he kicked your ass in basketball.
You sounded just like Olivia Newton John.
So what do you do?
OhÂ okay.
She says she wants a break, and that's fine with me. I think I needed some time also.
Where did Heather go?
What a night. That was just what I needed.
I feel like a new man. I was getting so used to being rejected. I really liked her.
What do you mean it was "your treat?"
Buy what?
You mean Heather is a prostitute?
I can't believe this.
Get out of my house!
Out, now! I don't ever want to see you again.
Robin is never going to forgive me.
I don't want your help. I want you to leave.
And take that stuff out of here.
Hello?
Robin?
IÂ love you too.
IÂ wanted to.
You got it? Great.
My friend?
I'mÂ glad you liked it. I've wanted to do something nice for you, but I've been trying to give you your space.
Sure. I'll call you as son as I get home. Bye.
The concert. Oh Jesus.
Robin just called. I think we're getting back together.
This is the first time she asked to get back together.
Can't you get someone else to go?
What?
How do you know we're back together?
I don't want you messing around with my life. You've caused enough trouble as it is.
Look, I appreciate you helping me out with Robin. But you have to understand, I'm going to have to work extra hard to not screw this relationship up again.
So, you're okay?
All rightÂ well, take care.
I'm fine.
It can wait.
UhÂ I'm Steven Bartowsky. What's going on?
Hey, relax. I'm the one who's going to jail.
I didn't do anything. My cable guy gave me all that stuff as a present.
I swear it's true.
I don't know. I shouldn't have.
I'm fine! I didn't do anything! Please call my cable guy, his name is Ernie Douglas.
That's got to be a mistake. Oh, this is not happening.
Yeah, Dad, I did. It's all a big plan.
When can you get me out of here?
The entire weekend?
What did you hear? What did you hear?
Who are you?! What's your real name?!
Why are you doing this to me?
You set me up.
I'll never be your friend. You need help.
I will not touch it.
What are you doing? Stop it.
Stop it! Stop it!
Get off there! Are you trying to get me killed?
Guard! Guard!
You go near her, I'll kill you.
Hey, this is the guy who framed me!
I'm sorry dad.
I didn't do anything.
Will you ever stop mentioning that?
I'm fine.
I just want to get this over with so I can go home and get some rest.
Great. I feel. Bad. I've been kind of blowing Rick off lately.
What is he doing here?
When did you invite him?
At lunch? You had lunch with him?
Come here.
Maybe it's because I just got out of prison, where you sent me. I should just drag you to the police right now.
You son of a bitch.
What are you doing?
Very funny. Tony, go to your mother!
I know you beat up Robin's date.
You stay away from Robin.
I really don't want to play this game.
Woman. Woman.
No.
Can I pass?
Breast. Breast.
Center. Center.
I can't say that to my mother!
No, I've had enough. I can't do this.
I am not over-reacting. You're all being fooled by this guy! He's a felon for Christ sake!
I hate you! Get out of my life!
What? You have no idea what this guy is really like.
See what I mean!
You don't understand.
Robin, this guy is a sociopath. He leaves messages on my machine night and day. He shows up wherever I go. He won't leave me alone.
You know he was the one who beat up your date at that restaurant. That's right.
That's what he wanted. He was manipulating me. It feels so good to be honest about this. We're finally communicating. I've been wanting to tell you for so long, but he's been blackmailing me.
With a photograph.
Me with a... prostitute.
He set it up. He invited this woman to my party and didn't tell me she was a prostitute. I'm so glad we can talk about this.
When we weren't communicating. I invited you. You were out on a date.
She seduced me. That's what they do.
That's not the point. The point is this guy has been setting me up. He's responsible.
Robin you don't --
Where did that come from?
I'm sorry I've been blowing you off.
It's just, this guy is really doing a number on me.
You're the one who told me to offer him money so I could get free cable.
Ernie Douglas.
Did anyone notice I'm late?
Thank you.
Work's good.
Don't get me started. That guy has no vision. It's like working for Mr. MaGoo.
I know. Now if only someone at corporate smartened up enough to dump Hal, then I could really get some stuff done.
Chip! Chip, this isn't funny! Where are you?!!!
Leave me alone! I have no job, no girlfriend, no family anymore! It's over! You won!
Hello.
Chip and Ernie Douglas.
Carmine from "Laverne and Shirley."
So he doesn't even work for the Cable Company?
Oh my god. She's right. I am a smotherer. I'm just like him.
Hello.
Rick told me you were fired from The Cable Company. You're not even a real cable guy.
I swear to God, if you touch --
Don't do this. There must be some way for us to work this out.
Let's talk in person. Where are you?
You stay away from her.
I got the camera. You can't see me.
Hey Rick. I need to meet with you right away. I've got some information about this crazy cable guy.
That's great. Let's meet at the old school at nine-thirty.
I think he's been following me. Don't be late, buddy.
Be home! Be home!
Hey Rick. I'm really excited to hear what you found out about this nut.
No way.
Hello.
Rick.
Rick Legatos. He's a friend of mine.
Can I see him?
Hello.
You're not going to get away with this.
Was that Robin?
Where's Robin?!
Where's Robin?!!!
Tell me!
I got the point.
Hang on.
Stay away from her!
I love you too. You're right. We shouldn't get married. I've got a lot of problems to work out which have absolutely nothing to do with you.
Easy.
Don't do anything stupid.
No! This is not like anything! This is not a movie! We're real people! You're hurting us! This is reality!
Nooo!
You're not going anywhere.
Don't do this. You just need help. We all get lonely.
You're gonna be fine. Just come on up.
Is he going to be all right?
How's the move going?
You haven't called Robin have you?
You never should have asked her to marry you. You're the mad smotherer.
You forced her to evaluate the relationship. If you didn't propose she would never have realized how unhappy she was.
I can't. I'm working double shifts the rest of the week.
The other camera guy pulled out his back.
One piece of advice. Slip the cable guy fifty bucks, he'll give you all the movie channels for free. Even the dirty ones.
None of them say no, believe me. I'll talk to you later.
Shit! My fault! My fault!
Great. We need another man.
Oh really. That's sweet. All right Chip Douglas, you're on shirts. Let's play.
Yeah, whatever you say Chip.
What the hell was that? That's it. I've had enough.
Yeah.
Where do you know him from?
Steven invited me.
I don't know what your story is "Chip Douglas," but I'm going to find out.
I'm getting out of here.
You're whacked man. That guy is bad news.
I can't even deal. I'm outta here.
Steven, are you ready to go?
What?
So you're blowing me off? I can't believe this.

You do this every time. You only call me after a girl breaks your heart. "Oh Rick can I stay on your couch? Let's talk all night about how mean girls are." Then as soon as a relationship starts again it's bye-bye Rick. I don't know why I fall for it anymore.
Maybe I'll take MY cable guy.
You bet your ass you've been blowing me off.
I told you not to hang out with him.
You didn't tell me he was a psychopath.
I'll see if I can get my friend in research to track him down. What's his name again?
Ernie Douglas? Ernie Douglas? Why does that sound so familiar?
So we're nowhere. Ernie Douglas? Ernie Douglas?
Could you stop that?
Wait, could you start that again? Start tapping your foot again.
Bingo. "My Three Sons."
I've got a list of every cable installer fired in the last four years. Every one of these guys has the same physical description as our friend.
That's so sad that you know that.
He was fired for beating up a customer who yelled at him for being late. A company in Denver thinks they might have a lead on who he really is.
Why do you keep icing me man?
Hello.
Me too. I've got the whole story.
Why all the way out there?
Steven? Steven?
I hit the Holy Grail. This guy is deeply troubled. Only child. His mother was arrested for prostitution, and phone solicitation. Apparently she was some phone sex pioneer.
And get this, he was discharged from the Marines. He got mad at his Sergeant so he sent a weapons silo to Defcon Two using a Radio Shack computer. And that's not the half of it.
Steven, what are you doing here?
They liked it.
I thought we agreed we weren't going to see each other for a month.
That's wonderful, congratulations.
I don't think we should.
Don't put me in this position.
I love you, but I need to take some time on my own to see how I feel. You agreed to this. I meanÂ this is exactly why we broke up, because you never listen to me.
I can't get into this now. If you haven't noticed, I'm at work.
Steven. Congratulations. I know how much this means to you. You deserve it.
Oh.
Sometimes time apart is healthy.
So, are you doing anything tomorrow?
Really?
Okay, maybe I will.
You made some interesting choices laying out the room.
No, I like it.
So how's work?
How's Hal?
It's just great that you're getting to do it. It's a real step up.
It's nice to see you doing so well.
It's alright. We can watch it another night.
Who was that?
Yes. You left me five messages. It king of freaked me out.
I can't. I'm going to dinner with someone.
Not really a date.
They are.
I made it before we got together the other night. I knew you would freak out.
Yes, you are freaking out.
I'm not doing anything wrong. I'm allowed to date. It's not like we're back together. We had a good time the other night, and you're already pressuring me.
I will.
BlockSki? That sounds right.
Well, not really. We're kind of in a holding pattern. He wants more of a commitment, but I don't think I'm ready.
Skidoo?
Who is it?
There's no problem with my cable.
I didn't order this.
Was it a man named Steven?
Come on.
So, are you a friend of Steven's?
That's right. You fixed his cable the other night.
So you guys are going out a lot?
Did he say that?
Well, it's a little complicated.
I'm so sorry.
I promise.
I love you.
Yes.
That was so sweet of you.
You didn't have to do that.
Giving me free cable. Only you would do that.
Yes, your friend came by.
The Cable Guy. I liked him. He was kind of goofy, but nice. Thank you so much for doing that.
Well, I don't think we should make rules anymore.
Call me later if you're around?
Are you alright?
Chip Douglas?
Oh, hi. What's up?
What is it?
No, things are actually going really well.
Should I be worried?
I will. Good-bye.
Steven Bartowsky please.
Hello.
Me too. Believe me.
Well, you were right. Something's happening with him and he won't even acknowledge it.
You know his lawyer said that nobody named Ernie Douglas works for the Cable Company.
And he's saying he received all the stereo equipment from you.
I just feel like I triggered this with him. It's not that I don't want to get married, it's just I felt like he wanted to get married just to get married. I don't deal well with pressure.
God I could go for turkey and mashed potatoes now.
Exactly.
Are you sure you're okay?
You're not fine. When you say you're fine, I know you're not fine.
I wanted you to know I invited your friend. He was concerned about you.
Not Rick.
I invited him.
At lunch the other day.
Hello. You look great.
Vagina?
Erection?
Come on Steven. We're just having fun.
You're not a nuisance. Please don't go.
Steven, you're being an asshole.
I can't believe you.
I just think you were completely out of line. I don't know what's happening to you these days.
Sounds familiar.
But you took the credit for it?
Blackmailing you? How?
Of what?
What?!
When did you have a party?
And you were with a prostitute.
So that makes it better?
He didn't have sex with a whore. You did.
I don't want to hear it. Breaking up was the best thing we ever did. You have some serious problems, and it's not my responsibility to help you. I am only responsible for my own happiness.
It was Jerry Springer's "final thought."
How's Hal?
It's just great that you're getting to do it. It's a real step up.
All right, I'm ready.
This is really fascinating, but I really think we ought to go now.
I'm worried about Steven.
Steven.
Help me Steven!
Steven! Look out!
Steven!
I'm sorry I didn't believe you. I love you.
We'll work them out together.
Hello! Cable Guy!
Well, look who decided to show up. I was just gonna go collect my retirement pension.
Was I? So I'm the tardy one. Good to know.
off!
I'm just joking. Let's do this.
Oh, the old McNair place. I never thought they'd get the floors clean after what happened here.
They had a lot of cats.
Hey, this could be a cool pad. Here is a comment card.
Please mail it in when I am done.
perfectionissÂt.
Come on baby. Come on baby. Talk to me baby. Tell me where you like it. That's it baby.
Here's your sweet spot.
So your lady kicked you out.
In preparing your service I noticed you were previously wired across town at 1268 and a half Chestnut. Last week the billing was transferred to one Robin Harris. Smells like heartbreak to me.
No sweat.
Hey, I'm going to go to the hallway so I can access the floorboards. Don't be spooked if you hear someone crawling underneath you.
Put on your bathing suit 'cause you'll be channel surfing in no time.
Guilty, guilty, guilt-freakin-tee. I hope they fry this bastard.
The arrangement of your major appliances and your furniture was causing some noisy pics and hum bars in your reception. I moved a few things. Cleared it right up.
You programmed?
Then let me slave your remotes.
Ooh, maybe we should leave these two alone.
You know you're pretty good at this. You could be a cable guy yourself.
Now let me check your levels.
All right. That about does it. I just have some paperwork for you to fill out.
That gave me power of attorney over you.
Joking.
I'm about finished here.
Okay. I feel good about this.
Yeah!
You mean illegal cable?
Who told you that? I want his name.
You're offering me a bribe? What you have just done is illegal, and in this state if convicted, you could be fined five-thousand dollars or spend six months in a correctional facility.
I'm just jerking your chain. Wake up little snoozy. I'll juice you up. All it is is a push of a button.
Don't worry about it. I couldn't charge you. Your girl just booted you.
Hey, you're a 'nice' guy. You'd be surprised how many customers treat you like shit, like I'm a god damn plumber or something.
Here is my personal beeper number. It's just for my preferred customers. Never call the company, they'll just put you on hold.
Maybe some day I'll take you out to the satellite and show you how all this stuff works. It's really incredible.
How 'bout tomorrow?
What are you going to do, sit home and stew about your ex?
Oh, okay. I guess I crossed the line.
No? Cool. I'll pick you up at six-thirty.
Steven!!!! Stev-ey!!!! Let's go!!!!
Steven!!!!
Hey buddy!!! Come on down!!!
Howdy partner. Climb aboard.
Thanks for coming out. You know most people think cable is just a simple co-ax that comes out of the wall. They never take the time to understand how it works.
We're going to take a ride on the information superhighway.
ÂIt all started in Lansford, Pennsylvania where Panther Valley Television, with the assistance of Jerrod Electronics, created the first cable television system.
I went to Lansford once. It's the Cable Guy's Mecca. It was very emotional.
I come here to think sometimes. To clear my head.
There she is. Right now she's sending entertainment and information to millions of satisfied citizens.
See, I knew the moment I met you that you would appreciate this.

The future is now. Soon every American home will integrate their television, phone, and computer. You'll be able to visit the Louvre on one channel, and watch female mud wrestling on another. You can do your shopping at home, or play Mortal Kombat with a friend in Vietnam. There's no end to the possibilities.
Come on up! What are you waiting for?!
Sometimes I'll sit here and imagine that there are billions of bits of information surging through me.
When I was a kid my mom worked nights.
That's tough. You must have a lot of abandonment issues. Reality isn't "Father Knows Best," it's a kick in the face on Saturday night. But what doesn't kill us makes us stronger, right?
So?
So, you're pretty love struck about your lady, huh?
I hate that.

Women are a labyrinth. Can I be frank? I don't think you listen to her. I think you try to tell her what she wants to hear. She wants you to thirst for knowledge about who she is. All the complicated splendor that is woman. When your love is truly giving, it will come back to you ten-fold.
Yeah, it was Jerry Springer's final thought on Friday's show.
You know what? Women are suckers for "Sleepless in Seattle." It's on HBO this month. That's your bait right there.
They all do. Next time you talk to her tell her you're cooking yourself dinner, and watching it by yourself. Sound like you're happier than a pig in shit.
You really want to know my name? You do?
Let's just remember right now. You know some people walk through their entire lives and never find a true friend.
I guess we're the lucky ones.
Later buddy. I'll catch ya' on the flip side.
Hey, you guys play here, too? Cool. I was just in the neighborhood. Thought I'd run the court for a couple of innings.
We met about a week ago during a routine installation, but I feel like I've known him my whole life.
No, I want to be on Steven's team. I'm skins.
Wait a sec'. I've got to warm up.
Let's get it on!
Feed me under the boards and you'll find out.
Traveling! That's traveling!
All right, so we're playing that type of game. Prison rules. I get it.
Feed me the rock! Feed me the rock! I'm open!
And one! That's definitely a foul!
You want to mug me, my wallet is in my other pants.
Don't play from fear Steven. We can take these guys.
Take it to the hole!
Hey, are you okay?
Let's switch. I'll cover Rick.
Good game.
You were tough out there. Your play brought me up to a higher level. I mean that.
It was payback time. I was protecting you.
I don't appreciate your tone Steven.
Well let's fix that. Let me buy you a Heineken?
Well, uh, I guess we'll talk later. I've got to go shower up and do some stuff.
And down low.
Too slow. Have a good one.
Replies.Didascalie: (pulls his hand away so Steven misses it)

Replies.Reply: What's up Steven? I'm at a pay phone. If you're there pick up. Pick up. Pick up.
Okay I'm home now. Give me a buzz when you get in. I'll be here pretty much all night. Bye.
Hey Steven. Quick question, give me a call when you get a chance.
I was just taking a whiz, thought you might have called. Okay later.
Sorry, I had call waiting, didn't get to it, thought it might have been you. All right, bye.
ÂWe're having ourselves quite a little game of phone tag here. You're it!
ÂI was just blow drying my hair and I thought I heard the phone ringing.
Âyou're a tough man to reach.
I guess you're too busy to call your friends.
Shit.
Is there a problem with your service?
Really?
So you called me. Interesting how you call when you need something. Is that how you treat people?
But calling me back isn't?
Why should I help you? I gave you free cable. What have you ever done for me?
Tomorrow night, we hang out.
God bless you. You're too good to me.
All set.
That's for effect. See ya' tomorrow Steven.
She's pretty. And don't kiss her. Don't even touch her. Fight the urge at all costs. It will pay off later withÂ  He makes a motion which implies sex.
Enjoy the flick.
Sorry about yesterday. I was in kind of a weird mood. How'd things go with you?
Don't peek. I want this to be a surprise.
Only the best restaurant in town.
Okay, here we are. Open sesame.

So ends day fifty-four of the trial of former child star Sam Sweet who has been accused of shooting his twin brother, Stan, in cold blood. The twins were stars of the hit sitcom "Double Trouble"

Life wasn't so sweet after the cancellation of their program. Hollywood chewed them up and spit them out. A frustrated Sam turned to petty larceny, while his more impressionable brother, Stan, fell in with a fringe cult called "The Brotherhood of Friends." Reduced to tabloid fodder a fury was growing inside of Sam. A burning need to be recognized as an individual, not a person famous for having an identical twin. A need that took the form of four shotgun blasts on the night of November fourteenth. And so today his attorneys continue the unusual defense of "Twin Envy."
